page.title: 07TRANSPORT ROAD TRAFFIC COUNT
page.content:
This survey showed that, in general, more traffic travelled from the direction of Leicester than from Market Harborough. By far the most common form of transport along the A6 was the car. A 'special' category was also recorded which has not been tabulated. This 'special' category revealed that between the hours of 0940 and 1500 the following additional traffic was seen.
Travelling from Leicester: 6 coaches; 6 ambulances; 3 cars towing caravans and a petrol tanker.
Travelling from Market Harborough: 1 coach; 8 ambulances; 2 police cars and a travelling library van.
